newsitem.title: LATVIA: Another Latvian bank to launch bourse index.
newsitem.headline: Another Latvian bank to launch bourse index.

text.p: Latvian bank Rietumu Banka said on Tuesday it is to launch two indices to be released at the end of each week that will track the Latvian bourse.
The indices are called Rietumu-16 and Rietumu and will be launched later this month.
"Both indices have been calculated from January 1 1997 and reflect the dynamics of share values on the Latvian stock exchange," Rietumu said in a statement.
Rietumu-16 will track the top 16 stocks in terms of capitalisation, liquidity and price while the Rietumu index will track all stocks on the official and secondary lists.
"We will provide the indices each Friday," a bank spokesman told Reuters.
The 16 include the three official list shares Riga Transport Fleet, Staburadze and Unibanka and 13 secondary list companies.
Fellow commercial bank Saules Bank earlier on Tuesday said it has launched its own index, the Saule10, which tracks the 10 most liquid shares on the bourse.
The Riga stock exchange has said it plans to launch its own index later this year.
The market opened in 1995 and volumes and the number of stocks available for trade have been growing steadily.
